snippet: A federal appeals court on Monday denied the request by four prisoners in Oklahoma to delay their executions, rejecting their claim that the drugs to be used could result in unconstitutional pain and suffering.
abstract: Federal appeals court in Denver denies request by four Oklahoma death row inmates to delay their executions, rejecting claim drugs are unreliable.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court on Monday denied the request by four prisoners in Oklahoma to delay their executions, rejecting their claim that the drugs to be used could result in unconstitutional pain and suffering.

headline.main: Oklahoma: Request to Delay Four Executions Is Denied
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma: Request to Delay Four Executions Is Denied
